name: Restoration Explorer
text: To begin, select a region to view.
globalText: Modify the sliders to change the values on the map (refresh takes a couple seconds).

mainToggle.text: Toggle Restoration Score on or off

items.help: Depths < = 6 feet are more suitable for oysters in NC region. All areas 6 ft deep or less = 4. other = 0
Salinity between 5-25 ppt is more suitable for oyster growth. Zones of optimal salinities between 15â€25 ppt = 4; 5-15 ppt = 2 (still very good but not optimal); Less than 5ppt = 0.
Areas closer to established reefs are favorable for recruitment. Areas within 1 mile from existing oyster clutches or sanctuaries =4, others =0.

Near historical reefs are more suitable and are favorable for recruitment, but weighted as less important as existing reefs due to the confidence in the historical dataset. Areas within 1 mile of an historic reef are scored =2, other = 0.

Salt marshes and oyster reefs work synergistically; we would likely have higher biodiversity, sediment accretion, etc. if our reefs were near marshes that are connected to the shoreline. Areas within 50 m of a salt marsh that is not disconnected from the shoreline by structures parallel to shore (bulkhead, riprap) =4, other = 0.
Firm substrate without vegetation or shell is ideal for oyster growth. Existing benthic habitat is either intertidal or subtidal Firm, w/o vegetation, w/out shell = 4, other = 0.
Areas of closed waters are weighted higher due to the potential benefit of oysters filtering the water. Areas currently closed = 2, other = 0.
